channel.title: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?
channel.description: What is a VERY simple vps that is reasonable in price (~20-30$ a month) that would be good for my first vps? What do you guys use and would recommend that is reliable? As I said, this is my first time with a vps.

item.title: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Nobody is going to use it. Don’t bother.
Buy a yo-yo or whatever kids play with these days.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Justin Bieber:

ok sure, so what concrete reasons make digital ocean a development environment and not a production one? other than the fact that you’ve seen the word “developers” on the website and whispers of “development environments”?

DO is not a solution for businesses. end of. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DigitalOcean

DigitalOcean, Inc. is an American cloud infrastructure provider that provisions virtual servers for [size=36pt][b]software developers[/b][/size].[1]

Read full topic

item.title: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:12, topic:554858”]Who says it’s only for dev use? Digital ocean? You?

I’m just trying to understand why you would even say such a thing as I’ve used DO a lot and it’s never even occurred to me that it’s only aimed at developers not someone wanting to run a live service.[/quote]

Simple Cloud Computing, Built for Developers

It even states somewhere on the website it’s for development environments.

Read full topic

item.source: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?

item.title: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:10, topic:554858”][quote author=my-swagger link=topic=673781.msg4506521#msg4506521 date=1459619539]

[quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=673781.msg4506519#msg4506519 date=1459615244]

digitalocean is so easy Sinisoul can use it.

I wouldn’t recommend this anymore. They started to make their “credit” expire so I’ve had $100 on there for a while but now it’ll expire in April meaning il lose my $100.
[/quote]oh no that means you’ll actually have to pay for hosting??

Yes and if I don’t need a host anymore, I can’t simply just get a refund.
Also; digitalocean is not meant for production.
[/quote]what’s the issue with using it in production?[/quote]
Not really an issue but it’s for development so why would you use it for production?

Read full topic

item.title: Easy to use VPS for first-time user?
item.dc:creator: @skillforlif3 skillforlif3
item.description:
@skillforlif3 wrote:

Honestly,

Virtual private servers aren’t hard to use at all,

For example if you bought a LINUX based OS you would most likely die from not knowing all the commands, On the other hand theres operating systems based on windows OS such as Windows Server, Basic Interface of Windows 8 Just a little different.

You would basically set up a server on a Windows VPS like you would on a local computer.

Hope this Helped,
Jack

Read full topic
